adrFormatAddress: 315 Bowery, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text: I’m glad they kept the ambiance of the old CBGBs , but a 150 bucks for a T shirt ?cmon..

text.text: I’m glad they kept the ambiance of the old CBGBs , but a 150 bucks for a T shirt ?cmon..

originalText.text: Came all the way from Canada and made seeing the CBGB location a stop on my list of places. Was originally very excited to see old pieces of the wall encased. Had fully intended to buy something to help support this business upon seeping some of the history of the place preserved. However when I was approached by one of the employees and asked if I needed any help they completely ruined my experience. I told them I don't need any help and was exited to look around think about the history of the building. When they pressed further I expressed I was more excited about the history than the store itself (as anyone who loves music would be) they promptly told me "there's the door" for this. Saying I can leave because I should be more excited about the items in the store. I thought that having preserved some of the history that the business would have been happy to hear that people were excited about the place for the history but unfortunately I was wrong. I then purchased nothing because of this leaving sad and upset that these people unfortunately got a hold of such a important piece of musical history.

originalText.text: Super Sad. This place is the opitamy of everything that CBGB did not stand for. High end men's clothing store????? Wth? I love how they attempted to pay tribute to the true origins of this space by saving some memorabilia but a $500 sweater that I can get literally anywhere else for about $40 is just a slap in the face to all the legendary Punks that played here and hung out here. Can't believe it's not a bar and music venue. Bands should still be playing here. No one needs a $500 sweater or a $2000 jacket...EVERYONE needs affordable live music.

originalText.text: So sad... The homebase for punk, hardcore and lots of other good music. Also sad to see that the CBGB is now a boutique... Even when some of the old interieur is preserved. It is and it will not be the same. Cheers CBGB, it was a pleasure for me!

text.text: So sad... The homebase for punk, hardcore and lots of other good music. Also sad to see that the CBGB is now a boutique... Even when some of the old interieur is preserved. It is and it will not be the same. Cheers CBGB, it was a pleasure for me!

originalText.text:
Even as something else the associates there were very respectful to me knowing what past and huge part of punk rock history it had. They where busy but still had the time to talk to me about a thing or two with the old CBGB’s. Great taste in clothing as well in what is now a John varvatos store. Sadly a bit outta price range for a guy like me. Lol
But yes. If you love punk then this is the place to go full of history for a music lover.
